ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital
content.description:
Founded in 2001, ProMedica Bay Park Hospital is a community hospital serving the city of Oregon, Ohio, and our rural communities east of the Maumee River.

Our medical campus features:

  • A state-of-the-art hospital with 72 private beds.
  • A professional office building dedicated to doctors' offices and outpatient rehabilitation.
  • A treatment and diagnos​tic center.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital was designed with your comfort and healing in mind, with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Bay Park Hospital.

Give Online
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703

title: Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

Located at 2801 Bay Park Dr in Oregon, OH, this region's leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

About the ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Area

What is there to do outside?

  • Go fishing in Lake Erie
  • Relax at the Maumee Bay
  • Walk through the Pearson Metropark or Cullen Park
  • Check out Turtle Island on Lake Erie
  • See Toledo Harbor Lighthouse on Lake Erie
  • Sit by the water or play beach volleyball on the Maumee River Docks
  • Enjoy the nearby Toledo metro area

    • What restaurants are in the area?

    In a 15 mile radius from the hospital are delicious local and chain restaurants including:

    • Applebee’s Grill and Bar
    • Bob Evans
    • Burger King
    • Domino’s, Gino’s and Marco’s Pizza
    • Frisch’s Big Boy
    • KFC
    • Long John Silver’s
    • McDonald’s
    • Rally’s
    • Smokey’s BBQ Roadhouse
    • Tim Hortons
    • Tony Packo’s Cafe

    Don’t miss local spots:

    • The Cafe
    • Don’s Donut Shoppe
    • Maumee Bay Brewing
    • The Oliver House
    • The Oregon Inn

    Shopping:

    • Bartz Viviano Flowers and Gifts
    • Beth Allen’s Florist
    • Everything for Pets
    • Great Eastern Shopping Plaza
    • Meijer/Meijer Pharmacy
    • Menards
    • ProMedica Pharmcy

    When are the accommodations provided for me?

    Dedicated to providing the highest quality health care, the cancer center at ProMedica Bay Park campus features 72 private beds, a professional outpatient rehabilitation facility and a treatment and diagnostic center designed with your comfort and healing in mind with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.

    Nearby hotels include:

    • Hampton Inn Oregon
    • Holiday Inn Express
    • Sleep Inn & Suites
    • Express Motel

    Campus Maps

    Download this printable campus map.

    Directions and Parking

    Ample parking is available in our lots. Park in any non-reserved space. Handicap-accessible spaces are located near all entrances. Or choose valet parking at the main entrance from 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. The cost is $3. Get driving directions.

    For directions to patient rooms and amenities, stop at our information desk located inside entrance #2 by the professional office building. Ask a member of our team for assistance. We’re happy to help.

providers.name: MONICA VASQUEZ MSN, APRN,

title: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center 2801 Bay Park Drive, Oregon, Ohio (OH), 43616

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-690-7900. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds
  • Three triage bays

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Offering PCI for interventional cardiology
  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

title: ProMedica Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
1 ProMedica Parkway, Entrance B, Floor 4

content.description:
The Debbie Brass Children’s Cancer Center at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital provides comprehensive, compassionate care and support for children diagnosed with cancer, blood disorders and bone marrow failure syndromes. From diagnosis through recovery, from newborns to young adults, our mission is to treat and cure cancer and blood diseases by understanding the special physical and emotional needs of both the patients and their families.

Our pediatric cancer center is the only member in the region of the Children’s Oncology Group (COG). COG is the world’s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer clinical trials and research and is supported by the National Cancer Institute.

title: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital is located about 60 miles southwest of Toledo in Defiance, Ohio. Our facility was constructed in 2002, with state-of-the-art medical technology and access to some of the most experienced and talented medical professionals in our region.

We designed our hospital to promote a healing environment for all Defiance community members.
content.operatingBody: Visiting hours are flexible during open hours, 6 a.m. - 10 p.m.
content.volunteer:
Our volunteers make a difference in people’s lives everyday. At ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, you can connect with patients and their loved ones and make their experiences easier.

You can volunteer in the following areas:

  • Beautiful Beginnings. The ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary sends a mailing to new and expectant mothers. This includes advice and guidance for pregnancy, birth, and the first year of their child’s life.
  • Coffee Cart. Hot specialty drinks and doughnuts are sold by our ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary from the coffee cart in our hospital lobby, Monday through Friday mornings.
  • Gift Shop. The gift shop is located next to the main lobby and is staffed and run by volunteers. Open Monday through Friday.
  • Information Desk. Direct visitors and answer questions from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday through Friday.
  • Surgery Desk. Help check-in patients before their procedures, notify the families when they are needed, and help to transport patients to the entrance. The surgery desk is staffed Monday through Friday.
  • Thrift Shop. We accept and sell used clothing, accessories, and home décor to raise funds for our ProMedica Regional Hospital Auxiliary projects and services.

Learn more about volunteer opportunities at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. Contact Gina Sheffel, volunteer and retail manager, at 419-783-6800 or at Gina.Sheffel@promedica.org.

Download our volunteer application.

Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Defiance Regional Hospital.

Our volunteers make a difference in people’s lives everyday. At ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital, you can connect with patients and their loved ones and make their experiences easier.

You can volunteer in the following areas:

  • Beautiful Beginnings. The ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary sends a mailing to new and expectant mothers. This includes advice and guidance for pregnancy, birth, and the first year of their child’s life.
  • Coffee Cart. Hot specialty drinks and doughnuts are sold by our ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Auxiliary from the coffee cart in our hospital lobby, Monday through Friday mornings.
  • Gift Shop. The gift shop is located next to the main lobby and is staffed and run by volunteers. Open Monday through Friday.
  • Information Desk. Direct visitors and answer questions from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday through Friday.
  • Surgery Desk. Help check-in patients before their procedures, notify the families when they are needed, and help to transport patients to the entrance. The surgery desk is staffed Monday through Friday.
  • Thrift Shop. We accept and sell used clothing, accessories, and home décor to raise funds for our ProMedica Regional Hospital Auxiliary projects and services.

Learn more about volunteer opportunities at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. Contact Gina Sheffel, volunteer and retail manager, at 419-783-6800 or at Gina.Sheffel@promedica.org.

Download our volunteer application.

Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Defiance Regional Hospital.

Give Online
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place bi-monthly at noon at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-785-7301

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Defiance, Ohio
ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital

Located at 1200 Ralston Ave, in Defiance, Ohio, this regions leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Area

What is there to do in the area?

  • Visit Old Fort Difiance Parkand learn about the history
  • Walk through Independence Dam State Park
  • Play at the Diehl Park
  • Check out Auglaize Villiage
  • Go Putt Putt Golfing
  • Golf at Eagle Rock Golf Club

What restaurants are in the area?

Near the hospital are delicious local and chain restaurants including:

  • 4KD Crick Brewery
  • Bud's Restaurant
  • Carmine's Little Italy
  • Cosmo's Subs
  • Defiance Pancake House
  • Fricker's
  • Jersey's Gameday Grill
  • Kissner's Restaurant
  • Sweetwater Chophouse

What accommodations are provided for me?

Dedicated to providing the highest quality health care, the cancer center at ProMedica Defiance Regional campus features private beds and a treatment and diagnostic center designed with your comfort and healing in mind with wider hallways and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms with plenty of room for family members because we put you and your family first.

Nearby hotels include:

  • Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites
  • Hampton Inn
  • Quality Inn
  • Comfort Inn

Campus Maps

Download this printable campus map.

Directions and Parking

We’re located in Defiance, Ohio. About 45 minutes from Toledo. Get driving directions.

Park in any spot that is closest to your desired entrance.. Handicap-accessible spaces are located near all entrances.

Stop by our information desk inside the main entrance to get help finding a specific department, service, or a patient’s room.

 

Learn more about cancer care in Defiance

title: ProMedica Device Clinic - Cardiac Electrophysiology, Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD), Leadless Pacemakers, Loop Recorders, Pacemakers, Sub. Implantable Cardioverter Defib. (S-ICD) - 2940 N. McCord Road,, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43615

content.name: ProMedica Device Clinic
content.description:
The ProMedica device clinic is for patients who have had a heart device implanted. This includes pacemakers, implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD), subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (S-ICD), loop recorders and biventricular devices. It’s important to routinely check these devices to make sure they are working right and aren’t causing problems.

Our team is trained to check heart devices manufactured by leading companies including Abbott (formerly St. Jude Medical), Biotronik, Boston Scientific, LivaNova (formerly Sorin Group) and Medtronic.

    At each appointment, our experienced staff of nurses and cardiac electrophysiologists will check your device. The process is called interrogation. A specially trained nurse places a hand-held tool over your clothes on top of the ICD. The tool automatically sends the information that our team needs to:
  • Assess if the device is working normally
  • Confirm the battery life is okay
  • Determine if there have been any abnormal heart rhythm or stocks delivered (for ICDs) recorded
    The interrogation also includes:
      Perform a 4-lead ECG to monitor your heart rhythm
      Check the device for lead integration and signs of lead infection

Some devices can be monitored wirelessly from your home. A small box sits next to your bed. Every night, it collects information from your device and automatically sends it back to our office to review and monitor. This includes abnormal rhythms, lead integrity issues and battery information. For more information about our home monitoring program, please call our office at 419-842-3000.

content.name: ProMedica Endoscopy Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Toledo Hospital Endoscopy Center  at the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center

The ProMedica Toledo Hospital Endoscopy Center  at the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center is an outpatient surgical center in northwest Ohio that specializes in endoscopic procedures. The center combines quality care and state-of-the-art technology with comfort and convenience for patients having low-risk gastrointestinal procedures.
 
We perform more than 5,000 procedures at the ProMedica Endoscopy Center each year. The procedures use a flexible, lighted device called an “endoscope” to look inside the gastrointestinal cavities and organs. These exams help our physicians diagnose and treat a variety of conditions, including ulcers, intestinal bleeding, tumors, and polyps.
 
The ProMedica Endoscopy Center is affiliated with ProMedica Toledo Hospital, which is accredited by The Joint Commission. It is handicap accessible with sufficient parking and a comfortable family waiting room.

title: ProMedica Cancer Institute Fostoria Community Hospital Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Cancer Care
content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Cancer Care
content.description:
At ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital’s cancer and infusion center is your care connected to ProMedica Cancer Institute, the region’s cancer treatment leader. Right here, you have access to screenings as well as inpatient and outpatient treatment for various cancers. Our multidisciplinary network of knowledgeable oncologists are committed to providing you with timely detection, diagnosis and state-of-the-art treatment.

Cancer Treatment Services

Fostoria Community Hospital provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient cancer services, including:

  • Medical oncology
  • Chemotherapy
  • IV therapy (IV hydration, blood product transfusion, antibiotic infusion and iron infusion)
  • Injections
  • Foley catheter changes
  • PICC line maintenance
  • Implanted port maintenance
  • Blood draws

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-436-6640. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 9 private beds
  • All staff members hold PALS, NRP and ACLS certifications

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

title: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Dialysis Center - Outpatient Hemodialysis (adults only) - 506 Van Buren St., Fostoria, Ohio (OH), 44830

content.name: ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital Dialysis Center

address.addressOne:
506 Van Buren St.
On the campus of ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital

content.description:
ProMedica Fostoria Community Hospital’s Dialysis Center offers a comforting space to receive outpatient hemodialysis treatment.

The team consists of board certified nephrologists, nurse practitioners, registered nurses as well as a licensed social worker and registered dietician. We are a 10 station dialysis unit able to accommodate 36 patients; utilizing two shifts per day.

Receiving hemodialysis at the center offers several benefits to patients, including an opportunity to socialize with staff and other patients, consistency with treatment plans and a personalized care team. The center provides patient-centered care by supporting patients with more than just dialysis treatments. The dialysis team works with patients and their families to arrange specialty appointments, manage prescription medications, provide assistance with understanding insurance coverages and benefits associated with end stage renal failure, and arranging transient visits to encourage travel.

Patients are educated along the way regarding every aspect of their disease process. Our team of registered nurses provide monthly education and ongoing learning opportunities that are individualized to meet each patient’s needs. Our team works directly with social workers and care navigators at local hospitals to ensure patient safety and provide quality transitions of care following hospitalizations.

The center complies with all regulatory standards and is accredited by Joint Commission and Ohio Department of Health. In 2021, the center received a 3-Star Quality Rating from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

Download Campus Map

title: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont

content.name: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont
content.description:
Designed for you if you struggle to manage your heart failure. Whether you’ve been discharged from the hospital with heart failure or are already working with your cardiologist, our heart failure staff will:

  • Assess your current health.
  • Review your medications. And make sure they are working for you.
  • Provide you with additional patient education.
  • Address your concerns.

title: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

content.name: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center is a brand new, state-of-the-art facility on the second floor of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Providing the highest quality of heart rhythm care in Toledo, the center treats simple to complex heart arrhythmias. Our team of electrophysiologists is the largest and most experienced in Toledo. They treat premature ventricular contraction (PVC), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), atrial fibrillation (AFib), atrial flutter, atrioventricular nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), Wolff-Parkinson-White Syndrome, and ventricular tachycardia (VT).

Take a virtual tour of the ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

title: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

content.name: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Flower Hospital
5300 Harroun Road. Suite 010

content.description:
ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center resides on the campus of ProMedica Flower Hospital, a Division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of our cancer center.

 

ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania is the central hub of our ProMedica Cancer Institute’s services and highly-specialized technologies for cancer care. As an award-winning cancer center, we’re committed to giving you the best possible oncology care here in Toledo, Ohio. From early detection and diagnosis to inpatient and outpatient services, you’ll receive the full spectrum of cancer services at our Hickman Cancer Center.

Cancer Center Treatments and Therapies
As one of the largest radiation providers in the region, we offer highly-advanced cancer treatments and therapies:

  • Cardio-oncology keeps your heart healthy during cancer treatment.
  • Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System delivers higher radiation doses to smaller areas over a shorter time period.
  • HDR (high-dose rate radiation) therapy delivers higher radiation doses directly into certain tumors.
  • Outpatient medical oncology services treat and support people with cancer.
  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.
services: Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System

title: ProMedica Headquarters

content.name: ProMedica Headquarters
content.description:
Located in downtown Toledo along Summit and Madison streets, the ProMedica Headquarters campus consists of four buildings and an employee parking garage.

The Junction - 300 N. Summit St.
The Junction office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. Popular fine dining restaurant The Chop House is located on the first floor.

The Plaza - 300 Madison Ave.
The Plaza office building is part of the ProMedica Headquarters campus. The primary entrance is off Levis Square on Madison; however, you can also enter from Summit St. Starbucks and KeyBank are located on the ground floor.

The Steam Plant - 100 Madison Ave.
The Steam Plant, located on the banks of the Maumee River, houses the company headquarters. Visitors should use the Madison Street entrance, located near the river, just before the flag poles

The Summit Center - 333 N. Summit St.
ProMedica Senior Care offices are the main tenant/occupant in the Summit Center. Popular eatery Focaccia’s is located on the main floor.

The Depot - 202 N. Summit St.
Located at the corner of Jefferson Ave. and Summit St., the Depot is the parking garage for ProMedica's headquarters.

  • Monday - Friday, from 6:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., parking in the ProMedica Depot parking garage is limited to downtown employees and employee visitors, downtown YMCA members and Chop House employees.
  • Paid parking is available to the public at the Depot after 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, and on weekends (from 4:30 p.m. on Friday - 6:30 a.m. on Monday).

All non-employee visitors to ProMedica should park at any available public parking location. All visitors need to check in at the front desk to receive a visitor badge. Visitors are also required to have an escort in the building at all times.

Campus Map
For additional information, including addresses, public parking info and entrance locations, download our campus map.

Download Campus Map

title: ProMedica Health and Wellness Center

content.name: ProMedica Health and Wellness Center
content.description:
Imagine getting most of your healthcare services from one convenient location. The ProMedica Health and Wellness Center brings together a variety of medical services -- from physician offices to diagnostic testing to wellness education to retail -- under one roof. This makes it easier for you and your family to get the care you need. title: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont

content.name: ProMedica Heart Failure Clinic - Fremont
content.description:
Designed for you if you struggle to manage your heart failure. Whether you’ve been discharged from the hospital with heart failure or are already working with your cardiologist, our heart failure staff will:

  • Assess your current health.
  • Review your medications. And make sure they are working for you.
  • Provide you with additional patient education.
  • Address your concerns.

title: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

content.name: ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center
content.description:
The ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center is a brand new, state-of-the-art facility on the second floor of ProMedica Toledo Hospital. Providing the highest quality of heart rhythm care in Toledo, the center treats simple to complex heart arrhythmias. Our team of electrophysiologists is the largest and most experienced in Toledo. They treat premature ventricular contraction (PVC), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), atrial fibrillation (AFib), atrial flutter, atrioventricular nodal reentry tachycardia (AVNRT), Wolff-Parkinson-White Syndrome, and ventricular tachycardia (VT).

Take a virtual tour of the ProMedica Heart Rhythm Center

title: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

content.name: ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Flower Hospital
5300 Harroun Road. Suite 010

content.description:
ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center resides on the campus of ProMedica Flower Hospital, a Division of ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Take a virtual tour of our cancer center.

 

ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center - Sylvania is the central hub of our ProMedica Cancer Institute’s services and highly-specialized technologies for cancer care. As an award-winning cancer center, we’re committed to giving you the best possible oncology care here in Toledo, Ohio. From early detection and diagnosis to inpatient and outpatient services, you’ll receive the full spectrum of cancer services at our Hickman Cancer Center.

Cancer Center Treatments and Therapies
As one of the largest radiation providers in the region, we offer highly-advanced cancer treatments and therapies:

  • Cardio-oncology keeps your heart healthy during cancer treatment.
  • Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System delivers higher radiation doses to smaller areas over a shorter time period.
  • HDR (high-dose rate radiation) therapy delivers higher radiation doses directly into certain tumors.
  • Outpatient medical oncology services treat and support people with cancer.
  • Infusion services support medical oncology and non-oncology patients requiring infusions but who don’t require an inpatient stay.
  • Software programs assist in treatment planning and pain management.
  • Eclipse™, a comprehensive treatment planning system that simplifies complex radiation therapy planning for each patient on a case-by-case basis.

Lung Clinic
Get a customized lung cancer treatment plan at this lung specialist-lead clinic. Learn more about the ProMedica Cancer Institute Lung Clinic.

Genetic Testing
If you have multiple cancer risk factors, we offer a genetic testing program led by our dedicated medical director and licensed genetic counselors. Learn more about genetic cancer testing at ProMedica.

Survivor Center
The ProMedica Hickman Cancer Center is home to the Survivor Center, a program for you if you’ve completed active cancer treatment.

Learn more about ProMedica Cancer Institute.
services: Trilogy Linear Accelerator and Stereotactic System

title: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology - Sylvania - Clinical Research Trials, Dysplasia Evaluation and Management, Medical Oncology, Post-treatment Surveillance, Registered Dietitian Support, Surgical Oncology - 5308 Harroun Rd., Sylvania, Ohio (OH), 43560

content.name: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology - Sylvania
content.description:
ProMedica Physicians Gynecology | Oncology – Sylvania is the largest Gynecology Oncology practice in the area. All of our providers are trained in dysplasia and colposcopy from the American Society for Colposcopy and Cervical Pathology(ASCCP). Our ProMedica Cancer Institute Women’s Sexual Health experts are specially trained in understanding the unique physical and emotional effects that cancer treatment can have on a woman’s sexuality. Our providers also specialize in:

  • Patient education on women’s health conditions, lifespan changes and overall wellness.
  • Medical management for a variety of sexual health conditions, including those related to the side effects of cancer treatment.
  • Post-operative care for gynecologic oncology patients.
  • Registered dietitian support.
  • Post-treatment surveillance.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâs Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access 2142 N Cove Blvd, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access
content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies

WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN (WIC) is the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants and children.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • NICU Cuddler
  • Child Life (Pediatrics)
  • Hospitality
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on children's health in our community. ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Ebeid Children's.

Give Online Today
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. for Teen Council at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
The Region’s Only Dedicated Children’s Emergency Center

After all, kids are special. And that’s just the way we treat them. At ProMedica Ebeid's Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, Emergency Center:

  • Features nine child-friendly pediatric care rooms.
  • Is served by pediatric and emergency physicians 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • Is staffed by professionals who are specially trained to treat children's medical needs and have pediatric advanced life support (PALS) certification.
  • Is furnished with kid-sized treatment and diagnostic equipment.

When do you need the ER? At times, it's difficult to decide whether to take your child to the emergency room, an urgent care facility or to your child's doctor. Our “When Do I Need the ER?” has helpful tips.

If you think your child is experiencing an emergency, don’t hesitate. Call 9-1-1.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâs Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access 2142 N Cove Blvd, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access
content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • NICU Cuddler
  • Child Life (Pediatrics)
  • Hospitality
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on children's health in our community. ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Ebeid Children's.

Give Online Today
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. for Teen Council at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on children's health in our community. ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Ebeid Children's.

Give Online Today
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. for Teen Council at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
The Region’s Only Dedicated Children’s Emergency Center

After all, kids are special. And that’s just the way we treat them. At ProMedica Ebeid's Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, Emergency Center:

  • Features nine child-friendly pediatric care rooms.
  • Is served by pediatric and emergency physicians 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • Is staffed by professionals who are specially trained to treat children's medical needs and have pediatric advanced life support (PALS) certification.
  • Is furnished with kid-sized treatment and diagnostic equipment.

When do you need the ER? At times, it's difficult to decide whether to take your child to the emergency room, an urgent care facility or to your child's doctor. Our “When Do I Need the ER?” has helpful tips.

If you think your child is experiencing an emergency, don’t hesitate. Call 9-1-1.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Childrenâs Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access 2142 N Cove Blvd, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital - Pediatric Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access
content.description:
The Sedation Infusion and Vascular Access Center is located on the fourth floor of ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. The outpatient center was updated in January 2022 and consists of one bronchoscopy room, six private infusion rooms, one treatment and one procedure room.

Services at this Location

The patients cared for range from new born to 17 years of age, and are seeking procedural sedation for minor tests and procedures, recurring infusions, and vascular access health care needs, such as, but not limited to:

  • Sedation for minor procedures/testing- MRI, CT, Nuc Med, Interventional Radiology, Gastrics, Audiology, EEG, Echocardiogram, PICC Insertion, and Lumbar Punctures
  • Pediatric Intravenous device placement for Radiology, Hematology/Oncology, and hospitalized patients experiencing difficult vascular access.
  • Ultrasound guided vascular access- lab draws, peripheral IVs, Midlines, and PICC line insertion.
  • Central line declotting and troubleshooting
  • Intravenous infusions, enzyme replacement therapy, and immunoglobulin therapy
  • Stimulation testing
  • Bronchoscopy and Upper Airway evaluations- provide nursing care and assist for pediatric/neonatal non-sedated and general anesthesia bronchoscopy
  • Urinary catheter placement for fluoroscopy and nuclear medicine studies
