title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • NICU Cuddler
  • Child Life (Pediatrics)
  • Hospitality
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on children's health in our community. ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Ebeid Children's.

content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 5 p.m. at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. for Teen Council at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-291-4000

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, is a 169-bed facility in Toledo, Ohio established in 1993, and has grown to be the region’s leading pediatric care facility. We offer a full spectrum of medical services to meet the unique needs of children from birth through adolescence.

  • We're accredited by the Joint Commission. We strive to meet the highest national standards for safety and quality of care and are committed to continually improving patient care.
  • We’re the region’s largest Level II pediatric trauma center, providing high quality trauma care for patients during any life emergency.
  • The Hillabrand Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is a Level III 72-bed unit providing care for premature babies as early as 22 weeks gestation and as small as 400 grams (14 oz). Our NICU has individual patient rooms designed to mimic the sheltered environment of a mother's womb.
  • Our pediatric cancer specialists treat patients in our state-of-the-art, yet youthful and whimsical, Debbie Brass Children's Cancer Center.
  • We're the first dual-certified asthma program for treating both inpatient and outpatients by the Joint Commission in Ohio.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • NICU Cuddler
  • Child Life (Pediatrics)
  • Hospitality
  • Advisory Councils

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPF 2-step/T-spot (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of immunity tetanus/diphtheria/pertussis or Tdap
  • Present proof of flu immunization during the flu season.
  • Present proof of MMR immunization of a positive MMR Titer.
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided by ProMedica Toledo Hospital free of charge.
  • Volunteer applicants must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we cannot handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum service time commitment.
  • We'll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our online volunteer application.
  • If you do not have computer access, you may call us to request a volunteer application.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

    • To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

    Apply Online

    Our Auxiliary

    Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals' health and wellness mission. Consider joining us!

    For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3775.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on children's health in our community. ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Ebeid Children's.

Give Online Today

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
The Region’s Only Dedicated Children’s Emergency Center

After all, kids are special. And that’s just the way we treat them. At ProMedica Ebeid's Children's Hospital, formerly ProMedica Toledo Children's Hospital, Emergency Center:

  • Features nine child-friendly pediatric care rooms.
  • Is served by pediatric and emergency physicians 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • Is staffed by professionals who are specially trained to treat children's medical needs and have pediatric advanced life support (PALS) certification.
  • Is furnished with kid-sized treatment and diagnostic equipment.

When do you need the ER? At times, it's difficult to decide whether to take your child to the emergency room, an urgent care facility or to your child's doctor. Our “When Do I Need the ER?” has helpful tips.

If you think your child is experiencing an emergency, don’t hesitate. Call 9-1-1.

title: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.name: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center
content.description:
The Finnegan Family Autism Center works to set standards to diagnose autism early, offer options for individualized interventions and provide continued care and support. The center is home to the Autism Early Learning Program, as well as Avenues for Autism and iTaalk. The University of Toledo Occupational Therapy Department supports open play sessions in our indoor and outdoor play/sensory areas.

Autism Early Learning Program

When your child is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder, you want solutions and services that address their unique needs.

Located in the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center, the Autism Early Learning Program offers early intensive behavioral intervention services for children with autism utilizing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). The program operates year-around with options for full day and partial day services from the age of diagnosis through 6 years.

Each child’s program is individualized with intervention focusing on building skills in the following areas: communication, behavior, play, socialization, adaptive, and developmentally appropriate skills acquisition. Services are implemented in classroom or therapy settings with 1:1 ratios and options for group learning as appropriate. Dependent on a child’s skills and needs, group learning settings with a behavior analytic approach are also available. Parent training and participation are integral to every child’s success and are mandatory across all programs.

Services at the Autism Early Learning Program are provided by board certified behavior analysts (BCBA) and center-based behavior technicians. Additional therapy services such as speech and language therapy can also be accessed at the center. All services are provided in accordance with Ohio licensure laws.

Enrolling in the Autism Early Learning Program

If you think your child would benefit from the Autism Early Learning Program, our staff can assess your child’s unique needs to determine how best we can support your family.

If we believe our program will help you, we’ll arrange an appointment with one of our team members. If we don’t think the program is a good match for your situation, we’ll recommend other options or provide referrals. Call us to enroll at 419-291-7080.

Parent Involvement

Our goal is to provide the best services possible for children with autism. We encourage you to be an active participant in your child’s - intervention. This includes:

  • Daily written correspondence with your child’s team.
  • Home visits twice a year by your child’s behavior analyst.
  • Parent training participation as indicated in your child’s individualized treatment plan. This may include observation of your child interacting with their team at the center and you demonstrating and practicing skills with your child.

Insurance Coverage and Costs

The Autism Early Learning Program accepts most insurance plans. Potential costs would be dependent upon your insurance plan. Please check with your health plan for specific coverage information.

We are also an approved Ohio Department of Education Autism Scholarship provider. Outside agencies and school districts may also contract for program services.

Operational Hours

ProMedica’s Autism Early Learning Program does operate year-round. Our offices are open 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. ABA services typically take place between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Understanding Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Our Autism Early Learning Program team at the Finnegan Family Autism Center is trained in applied behavior analysis (ABA), a science that uses behavioral techniques to teach children basic and complex skills. It works by reinforcing appropriate behavior while decreasing or eliminating interfering behavior. Opportunities for success are built into the program and adjustments are made as children progress, helping them function better in the world.

The goal of ABA is to go from a 1:1, highly structured teaching environment to a less structured teaching environment in a small group. Then, to go to a naturalistic, large group general education setting.

While using the principles of ABA, we systematically teach and reinforce small, measurable and attainable units of targeted skills. Every skill (small or complex) is broken down into small steps. Each step is practiced until success is achieved.
